title: Fix white screen / blank app rendering issue

requirements.summary: Fix the application not rendering â€” ensure the React app mounts correctly and the full ConvertHub interface (Hero, ToolGrid, Footer, FloatingParticles) is visible on page load instead of showing a plain white page with raw repository/project name text.
acceptanceCriteria: Opening the app URL shows the ConvertHub dark glassmorphism UI, not a plain white page
The Hero section with the ConvertHub logo and tagline is visible
The 8 tool cards are displayed in the responsive grid
No raw repository/project name text is shown to the user
Browser console shows no fatal JavaScript errors on load
The React root element is mounted and renders the full App component tree

file_operations.description:
Remove or comment out any visible text content showing 'pdf-image-converter-toolkit' or 'Exported from Caffeine project' that appears in the body. Ensure only the
element is present as content, with all text moved to meta tags or removed entirely. Verify the root div is correctly placed and not hidden by other elements.

Add defensive null checks and error logging at the component mount level. Wrap the return statement in a Fragment if needed and add a data-testid or console log to confirm the component renders. Ensure ErrorBoundary is properly wrapping all child components and that the FloatingParticles, Hero, ToolGrid, Footer, and ConversionModal render without throwing exceptions.

Verify the component renders without errors. Check that any image references (e.g., logo or background images) use correct paths. If the component references frontend/public/assets/generated/converthub-logo.dim_256x256.png or frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x600.png, ensure those paths are valid and the images are loaded as static assets. Add fallback rendering or alt attributes to prevent blank renders if images fail to load.

Add error handling around canvas operations to prevent crashes if the canvas element is null or if getContext('2d') fails. Ensure the component does not block rendering of other UI elements if animation initialization fails.

requirements.summary: Audit index.html to confirm the React bundle script tag is present, points to the correct entry file, and that the root div with id='root' exists. Ensure CDN scripts for PDF.js, jsPDF, pdf-lib, and Mammoth.js are loaded synchronously before the React bundle so all globals are available at runtime.
acceptanceCriteria: The React entry script tag references the correct module path
All CDN library script tags appear before the React bundle script tag
PDF.js workerSrc is set in an inline script after the PDF.js CDN script loads
Page loads without 404 errors for any script resources
